dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to a real moon. Then cut wide to a moonlit landscape, which the camera careens madly. The soundtrack, which was almost sacred in the mural chamber, erupts into a tribal glimpse creatures in the darkness, moving through the ree barely more than silhouettes. We see teeth, and gleaming glimpses of naked, patterned flesh. Only glimpses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut back to the mural chamber. Now we have moved away fro to a more brutal scene. A symbolic representation of a gr apocalyptic war between Naturals and Breed. Terrible scen destruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE: But the Naturals made war on us. They feared us fo strength. They envied our powers. They called us monsters by whatever means their malice could invent, finding in e our particular vulnerability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are scanning scenes of that war. A breed being staked vampire. Another being shot like a werewolf. Another expo sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE: None of us was safe. The tribes of the moon dwindl gods were slaughtered, our homes destroyed. It was the Ap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut back to the landscape. The clouds roil above the head creatures heading through the reeds. We see their destina huge wall, with gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And back to the mural chamber, and a final scene. The gat just seen are in the painting. Looking over them, calling in, is a vast indistinct form: that of Baphomet. His eyes arms are open in welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE: Only one of our Gods survived the holocaust. Bapho Wounded and near death, he summoned us, the last of the l hiding. Into Midian, where we wait now. The battle is ove the war. There will come a saviour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we've moved beyond the image of the gate into a new p wall on which the pictures are only vague sketches. We ca some of the images nevertheless: a man with a bloody hole middle of his chest. A man wearing a mask like a skull. W a faceless figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE: His name is Cabal. He will lead and give us back t We are the tribes of the moon. We are the Nightbreed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The titles end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut back to the landscape. Now we are at the gates, and t creatures slip through and away into the mist. Only one, ferocious female called Shuna Sassi remains, turning to l She beckons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUNA: Come...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera retreats from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUNA: Will you not come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the last of the creatures, the Drummer, takes her by snatching her away through the gates. As she disappears, follows again, stopping at the gates themselves, which cl unearthly din.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. on Boone, closed eyes. He is dreaming. His gaze rove his lids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's lips come into shot kissing first his eyes and the down his face to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Boone...wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone's eyes flicker open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Hi. You OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Boone's eyes are fully open. He sits up. Looks toward window. Night beyond. She kisses him, distracting him fro of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: You want something to eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Sure. What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Nine-thirty. I was letting you doze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Thought you'd worn me out, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori smiles, and kisses him, then crosses the room to the area, picks up some fruit, and a knife, carrying both bac Boone is lying on the bed. It is unmade. Both Lori and Bo lightly dressed, clothes casually thrown on after an afte lovemaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori: You know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: We should get out of Calgary for a few days. Just t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Anywhere special?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Somewhere we can be alone together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: More alone than this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Yeah. Just you and me. No work. No telephone calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Bad dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: No bad dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I know. I always know. It's no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I'm going around in some crazy loop in my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: You're not crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Say it like you mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I believe it. I'm not crazy. But I want this damn of my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up and goes to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Decker's started calling me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: All last week. Every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: What does he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I don't know. I haven't called him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: If he can help, see him. Tell him it's all gone but dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: They're not bad. That's what's weird. The more I h the more I like them. Now I do sound like a crazy, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: No. You sound like the man I love. A little haunted but the sanest man I ever met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Will you see Decker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: You think I should?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Where's the harm? You tell him from me, I'm the onl should be dreaming about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I don't think he'd get it. He never had a wet drea life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I don't want to be competing with things I can't se Can't share I don't want to be always feeling that someth pulling at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I'm not going anywhere, Lori. Except with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I can't hear that often enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I'll never leave you. Not ever. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her, passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Can't remember a time when I didn't love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: How about before we met?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Even then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss again. We move past them into the darkness outs window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dissolve to the moon, clearing cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pleasant house in a pleasant neighborhood. Lights burn

dialogues.text: Melissa Rickman emerges from the lounge, with a Dagwood s work in progress. She is thirty-five, and going to seed i way. Her husband, Lou Rickman, a similar type, is planted the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELISSA: Okay, you want ham, cheese, pickle, mustard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOU: All of the above and a brewski, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELISSA: You're getting porky, Lou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOU [amiable - tried to grab her]: I'm comfortable. I lik fat. I like you fat too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELISSA [secretly amused - she hushes him]: Keep it down, you'll wake the munchkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears something upstairs, goes to the foot of the sta up. Her eldest son, Lou Two, waddles into view. He's five

dialogues.text: MELISSA: Sweetie, you're supposed to be beddy-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELISSA: What did you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELISSA: No, everything's okay. You go back to bed, munch be up to see you in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOU [V.O.]: How's that sandwich coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELISSA: Coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa disappears from the bottom of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa enters, moves out of sight. We stay at the door. appears dressed in black, knives in both hands, and cross the screen again. We do not see his face. But we hear his the sound of the blades slicing Melissa. She staggers int grabbing hold of her slit throat. Blood bubbles between h The figure appears behind her. She turns, as the knife de

dialogues.text: Lou hears a sound, rises and moves towards the kitchen do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the stairs, Lou Two watches wide-eyed.

But the figure is much stro glimpse its face now, it is a mask, with a zipper for a m buttons for eyes, blank. Devoid of compassion, hatred or death's head, made by a mad child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atop the stairs, Lou Two listens. His baby sister cries i He looks her way then back downstairs. The sounds cease. Terror on his face. Then the child's perfect nightmare ap bottom of the stairs. The figure, heavy knife in hand, st climb, dragging Lou's bloody body after him by the hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [thru phone]: Boone, pick up will you? Boone? Are yo Boone? Okay, so don't answer. See you tomorrow...G'night.

dialogues.text: Three patrol cars, an ambulance, policeman restraining a gathered outside. A n.d. sedan roars up, red bubble light and Inspector Joyce gets out and moves towards the house. greeted by the Medical Examiner, Dr Burton, just exiting, medical bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURTON: Unmistakable. Doesn't miss a trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURTON: If it's any comfort, they went quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Yeah. Makes me feel a whole lot better about the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURTON: Find this guy, Joyce. They say these guys want to I think this one likes it too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: DECKER: I've been listening to the tapes of our sessions. years' worth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move from the tapes to Decker, who gets up from his de moves around to the other side. Boone is sitting on the o the desk, his posture far from relaxed. He hates this roo moves, we take in the various pictures on the walls. Danc photographs of Decker with civic dignitaries, crippled ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Most of my colleagues would have walked away from like yours. The most they would have done was drug you. B intrigued me. All the talk of monsters. And Midian. Remem

dialogues.text: BOONE: That wasn't me. I heard about Midian from other pe

dialogues.text: DECKER: But you made it part of your private mythology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I suppose I did. It was a place of refuge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: When you imagined yourself being taken off to thi city, to Midian, what crimes were you going to be forgive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone's looking uneasy now. He wipes sweat from his upper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Yes. There's a remarkable consistency in the imag Great detail. Almost as though the violence was real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: They were just bad dreams. Midian doesn't exist. M don't exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: But murder does, Boone. Murder's very real. It ma the mind, but it ends up changing to flesh and blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the envelope we saw in his previous scene, an photographs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [cont.]: Two days ago the police brought me some photographs. They wanted to know if I had any patients wh capable of what's in these photographs. I'm going to show Are you ready for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker lays the photographs on the table. Boone picks the get glimpses of what they contain. Domestic horrors. Bloo corpses caught by the camera in grotesque positions, slic bleeding. Boone's breath quickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [cont.]: When you talk about murder on the tapes, it was invention. Now I'm not so sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone keeps staring at the pictures. The glassy eyes star him. His breathing is now rapid and shallow. One or two o seem to move. Bodies twitch. He drops the photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Didn't what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: They were bad dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: What you describe in your sessions is very specif faces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: You want to hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker picks up the photographs. Boone, highly agitated, paces the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE[cont.]: You think I did this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Six families killed over a two year period. All w driving distance of Calgary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [fury]: Do you think I did this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: I hope to God you didn't, for both our sakes. We' long way together. I don't want to believe this any more

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: But you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: I wouldn't put us through this pain if I didn't.. wasn't...afraid you had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [desperate; helpless]: What do I do? God, tell me w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: I can only go so far on your behalf. Patient confidentiality's one thing. Protecting a killer is anoth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [breaking down]: Jesus...Jesus...Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker returns to his desk. Puts the photographs down and vial of prescription pills. He crosses to boone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Listen to me. Take these, they'll help. Go home, consider what we've talked about. I'm going to give you t hours to go to the police and answer their questions of y accord. That's as long as I can give you. if you haven't then, I'm afraid I'll have to tell them what I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone grabs the pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [cont.]: I can't tell you how sorry I am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone exits into the hall, forces open the vial of pills, couple, shaking, trying to control his terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker sits at his desk, lifts his briefcase, opens it, t folder of photographs into the case. Looking into the cas on the verge of some powerful emotion. Rage? Revulsion? H the briefcase. The emotion passes.

dialogues.text: Boone studies the photographs in his hand, and they come

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone chews the pills. He is now sweating and shaking vio Boone strips off his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone opens his drawers and pulls out photographs, his pa and starts to make a pile with them. He pours lighter fue pictures, and watches them burn. Sitting against the wall sweating he takes some more pills.

dialogues.text: We see Lori's love letters burn and hear her voice speaki words as they are consumed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori is sitting on the edge of the bed. Boone looks round himself against the wall and moves forward past the real the bed...

dialogues.text: Boone watches as he and Lori make love on the bed. We clo the love-making. Lori leans to kiss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I'll never leave you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut back to boone, his face all grief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone's hand pulls the shower curtain aside and turns on The water pours on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [faintly]: ...I did it...I did it all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, the last of the fire flickers. He looks throu blinds at the sunset. Takes another pill. Puts on his lea Exits. The door slams.

dialogues.text: NARCISSE [low and anxious]: They've gone, they've gone, t here, they were coming for me, where'd they go? Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Narcisse paces again, starting to sob and sniffle. Boone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: I said shut up, you want to ruin everything?

dialogues.text: Boone leaps to his feet, grabs and easily overpowers the

dialogues.text: BOONE: What did you say, just now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [suddenly friendly]: What did you say, just now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: You said Midian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARICSSE [coyly]: Did I? Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [hurting him - desperate]: What do you know about i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: It's where the monsters go. It takes away the p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Narcisse reaches his hands into his pockets, then comes o long, silver, razor-sharp artificial nails, curved like h attached to his thumbs. He holds them right at Boone's th to cut. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [cont.]: ...what do you know about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [pause; cautiously]: They forgive you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Uh-huh. Ever kill anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: See, they only take you if you're worthy. You k they do to those that aren't worthy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone shakes his head. Narcisse draws one razor-nail ligh his own throat. A thin trickle of blood runs down his nec chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: It's real. Midian's real. [Narcisse nods; carefull know...where it is. Don't you? We could go there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: They sent you. They sent you to take me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: That's right. But first I need to know...you have me...where it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: It's a test? [Boone nods; Narcisse leans in to whispers] No maps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: But you do know. Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [looks around; leans in again]: North of Athabas Peace River. Near Shere Neck, north of Dwyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied, Boone releases him, go back to the bed, collec jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [cont.] [ exhilarated]: You'll take me with you, worthy, you ask anyone, I knew you'd come, they sent you I was waiting. I know, I know, first I have to show you, it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone is looking out of the window in the door, sizing up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Show me what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: My true face. That's what there are for. [he ra bladed thumbs] So you can see. I'm not a natural man. Und a monster, that's how it works; I show you, then you take you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the blade to either side of his face. We hear the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood pours from Narcisse's face, as he traces the outlin face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Decker, who's just arrived with Lieutenant Joyce and t policemen, is speaking with the doctor that examined Boon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [urgent - showing Boone's file]: ...he was an aban child, raised by the state, first diagnosis of incipient schizophrenia at thirteen, juvenile delinquency, periodic institutionalized through early adulthood...some violent never criminally charged as an adult, he's been in my car than a year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bloodcurdling scream from the semi-private room rivets attention of the emergency room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following the nurse and an intern as they burst into the are greeted with the sight of Narcisse, blood running fre ripping the least of his scalp off his bare skull, laughi crying maniacally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone stands near the door, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [variously]: TAKE ME! TAKE ME! I'M A MONSTER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse [over - to Boone] What the hell have you done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone: Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERN: Fucking junkies! [at the door - yelling into the Doctor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door swings open, Boone looks out into the corrido the far end of the emergency room he sees Decker and the his way. Medical support move towards the room, as the nu intern try to contain the ranting Narcisse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone grabs a loose doctor's coat off the back of the doo on and backs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Let's get some help in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandemonium. Narcisse screams, as a half-dozen people str subdue him. As help continues to rush into the room, Boon backs away, out and around a corner. He stops beside a sw sensing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Decker moving through emergency towards the mГЄlГ©e, s other side of the swinging door, his senses lit up with a slowly turns to the door. Pushes it open. Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone moves rapidly away from the exit into the parking l off the white coat, breaking into a run. He tries several finds one open, gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a rush of adrenal intensity, Boone expertly rips ope panel of the dash, locates and patches together the corre wires and hot-starts the car. Closes the door. Puts it in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone slowly drives out of the lot trying not to attract attention of the fleet of patrol cars sirens wailing, pou the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone drives up an entrance ramp and onto the highway, pa that reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Decker, a few policeman and medical personnel wait out door leading to the semi-private room. Lieutenant Joyce e surgeon follows a moment later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: What's he saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: He's talking but he's not making any sense. Someth place called Midian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SURGEON: He's dying. I think he wants to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. The surgeon moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [unobtrusively - to Joyce]: Lieutenant, I know Boo how he talks, how he manipulates. Perhaps if the right th to this man it'll trigger something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE [consider]: No harm in trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: I'll do my best. But I'll need privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking in through the room, we see Decker cross the room where Narcisse is lying. Decker says something to the nur exits. Decker moves closer to the bed. He reaches into hi something and moves out of our sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montage - Boone drives through the night, and the followi through a landscape which becomes increasingly more desol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The road sign reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone's car speeds past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone's car rolls to a stop. Boone steps out and looks at in the dust. A battered sign. It reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no sign of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: No....oh no...[in despair] No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His shout echos. The wind blows up a cloud of dust around walks through the dust, on the verge of tears. And then.. clears, and he sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Necropolis, lying on the other side of a thick expanse of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puzzlement overtakes despair. He squints to see more clea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Necropolis is vast. High walls, surrounded by reeds, tops of mausoleums, showing above it. ALmost a fortressed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone starts towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is low in the sky, the light golden glinting off The reeds sigh. Boone pushes one of the gates open and st His footsteps echo, unnaturally loud in this city of the either side of him, elegant and elaborate mausoleums, run into the distance, with numerous smalls tombs set around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun finally sinks out of sight. Its final glow dies o of the mausoleums. There are already stars overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone walks on a little way, as the night sounds begin. E he sits down on a tomb and leans back against the stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [softly - a bitter irony]: Dead ... all of the dead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rummages for a cigarette in his jacket pocket. Pulls o Lights it. The flame seems to excite sounds around him. H The walkways are empty in both directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a guttural sound at his back. He stands, drops th cigarette, backs away. From the darkness behind him steps form. A knife is put to his lower belly. Its wielder, Kin massive man, face distorted, his features grotesquely bif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KINSKI [whispers]: Move and I gut you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone stays still. The growling from between the tombs be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE [from the darkness]: You got him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KINSKI: I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reptilian hand reaches out and picks up Boone's dropped

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Midian? Are you from Midian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KINSKI: We should take him below, Peloquin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silhouette of Peloquin, a were-creature, moves betwee tombs. He draws on the cigarette. By its brightening poin an extraordinary face: more animal than human, but no rec species.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: He's not Nightbreed. He's Natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: No! I've killed people, I'm like you, that's why I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: Shut the fuck up. You're meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KINSKI: If we eat him we break the Law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: My God...my God, it's true ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: Of course it's true. Everything's true ... [he emerge from the shadows] God's an astronaut. Oz is over t And Midian's where the monsters live. And you came to die

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I didn't...didn't come to die. I came to be with y of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peloquin reaches out and touches Boone's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: No. Sorry. I can smell innocence at fifty yards

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I've killed people. Fifteen people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: He lied, asshole. He lied. You're a Natural. An means...you're meat for the Beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peloquin growls, throwing his head back and forth with a grace, the image flickering as he does so. Boone watches, the blur of Peloquin's motion he transforms, the tentacle head lengthening and thickening, thrashing around as thou a life of their own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves towards Boone, taking hold of him and tearing hi open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KINSKI: We mustn't. It's the Law. They'll exile us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: Fuck the Law! I want meat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bites Boone's neck, tearing at his flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KINSKI: Peloquin, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinski takes the knife from Boone's belly and pushes Pelo Boone slips away from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: Damn you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He races after Boone, who runs blindly, his hand pressed wound on his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Breed listen. We track running feet past the grille, close into grille, dropping through a dark rock face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the deep darkness faces look up. The faces are strange freakish. There is a woman locked in the embrace of a dar monstrous baby cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone takes refuge against a mausoleum wall. He takes his the wound on his neck. It is throbbing like a living thin across his muscle. He stares down at the wound, then touc lightly. It gives him pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sound above him. He looks up. Peloquin is climbing down mausoleum wall, mouth opened wide to take off Boone's hea Boone throws himself forward as the jaws snap shut, missi inches. He runs. Kinski appears in his path. For an insta thinks the game's up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KINSKI: That way! The gate's that way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone sprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monsters watch and listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peloquin pushes Kinski aside and pelts after Boone, who i gate. He flings himself through, and slams it behind him. at the gate, when Kinski comes up behind and restrains hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KINSKI: He's gone, give it up! You don't dare go out ther

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peloquin stares at Boone through the gate. Panting, sweat stares back. Snorting with frustration, Peloquin recedes, Kinski disappear into shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone heaves a sigh of relief, turns from the gate and tr into the darkness, when suddenly . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harsh lights hit Boone from every side; police cars in th around, their searchlights focused on him. Two dozen cops levelling firearms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Freeze! Right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone squints against the glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE [cont.]: Aaron Boone, you're under arrest. Hands on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone takes a step back. The wound on his neck throbs and the edge of the light, Decker appears, stepping towards h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Boone, listen to him, it's no use!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE [to Decker]: Stay back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [lowers his voice]: Lieutenant, I can bring him ou listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce ponders, then signals him forward. Decker advances

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [cont.]: Boone, it's all right, I've explained eve them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rifles are cocked on every side. Decker stops a safe dist Boone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [cont.]: They won't harm you, I give you my word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [hanging back]: I didn't do it. I didn't hurt anyon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [lowering his voice]: Of course you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: You...you believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: You wouldn't hurt a fly. [extends a hand] Come on It's safe, I've seen to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [taking a tentative step forward]: What, what about

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [pause; whispers]: What about them, Boone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: They weren't tranquillizers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of alarm crosses Decker's face. Boone reads it. He picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [cont.]: You set me up...you bastard, you set me up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lunges for Decker, who turns and throws himself to the he yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: He's got a gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullets fly. Boone is about to pounce on Decker when a barrage, thrown back, riddled with bullets. On the grou covers his head. Boone goes down. The volley ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of gunfire echoes through the walkways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the shadows, a baby held in the arms of a woman with m but beautiful features, begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce hears the sound of crying and looks up. Boone's bod the ground. Decker rises, hearing the distant sobs on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother hushes the child, her arms, which are tentacle around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of crying is lost. Joyce moves forward, towards Boone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE [trying to convince himself]: ...just the wind. He Decker, looks down at Boone's body. Looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE [cont.]: Where's the gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [seemingly dismayed]: He reached into his jacket.. I saw it, I swear...oh God, Boone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE [quietly, to some cops, meaning Boone]: Get him out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We track towards a tomb, on which the epitaph reads: 'GOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving with Lori, flanked by Dr Burton the pathologist, a Joyce. They enter a smaller room. Burton flips a switch. part in front of a thick glass panel, revealing a small, viewing chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the chamber are a morgue attendant and, lying on a sta steel table, Boone's body. Lori looks at the body with he sadness. She nods. Burton closes the curtains. Lori and J On the other side of the glass, the attendant rolls Boone table towards a door marked 'Pathology'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Decker sits alone, looking into his briefcase. The doo Lori and Joyce enter. Decker closes the briefcase, rises, takes both of Lori's hands in his, speaks soothingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Lori, I'm Dr Decker. Boone was my patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Yes. Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: I'm so sorry for your loss. I must tell you, you world to Aaron. He spoke of you constantly ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [withdrawing her hand - has the creeps]: Thank you,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori sits across a table from Joyce. Decker sits against

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Miss Winston, are you sure you wouldn't rather pos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: No. Let's get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce turns on a tape recorder on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE [starting at the beginning]: What was your relation Aaron Boone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [pause]: We were lovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move in on the revolving reels of the tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: How long had you known Aaron Boone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Two months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton and the attendant, instruments laid out, Boone's b brightly lit steel table, ready for the autopsy. Burton a overhead microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURTON: Deceased is a white Caucasian male, late twenties cause of death, multiple gunshot wounds to the thoracic c extremities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attendant lifts up Boone's jacket. Light streams thro bullet holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASSISTANT: Jesus. They weren't takin' any chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton picks up a small digging tool and zeroes in on one chest wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURTON: Wound number one: entered between the fourth and ribs, impacted the lower rib, lodging in ligaments adjace left lung ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He digs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: So he never gave any indication ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: No ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Surely there must have been something ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [firm, angry]; Look, you can say whatever you want t him. I don't believe it. He never raised a hand to me, he never harmed anyone in his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strained silence. Decker drums his fingers on his brief

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Miss Winston, everyone has their secret faces ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Drop dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annoyed at Decker, Joyce turns off the tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: We'll continue this some other time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori stands and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of callipers drop a distended bullet into a steel containing at least ten other similarly maimed bullets. F effort, Burton wipes his forehead, turns off the micropho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURTON: Coffee break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attendant turns off the bright overheads, he and Burt into an adjoining lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori is putting on her coat. A contrite Decker approaches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Miss Winston, I hope you didn't misinterpret what Boone meant a great deal to me ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Where did he die? [pause] What was the name of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: A place called Midian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bowl wobbles on the ground. The bullets roll off in d directions. Sound of glass breaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing the breaking glass, Lori and Decker turn back tow autopsy room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Boone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs towards the sound, Decker follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In slow motion, a large first-floor window shatters out t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lori, then Decker enter, moments after Burton, Joyce a attendant. The autopsy table is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURTON: Someone's taken him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: My God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATTENDANT [looking around]: Where's his coat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow motion В— distorting time, we see the rest of the sh window and a dim figure crosses the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori hurriedly throws some belongings into a suitcase. We newspaper clippings beside the suitcase. A headline reads

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another features a map, showing the location of Midian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montage - Lori drives, at high speed, down the same roads previously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At sunset, Lori enters the town, past a sign that reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori pulls into the parking lot of the motel. A neon sign

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above it, the moon. From the motel itself, sounds of reve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wood-panelled, Western Frontier-themed bar. Country mus banner welcomes rodeo participants. A number of rough typ clustered at tables, many of them wearing baseball caps a buffalo horns. Lori enters, looks around. A cowboy lassoe waitress, ropes her in to general applause. Lori takes a bar and is approached by a bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTENDER: What'll it be, darlin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: A draft and some information please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTENDER [taps a stein of draft]: There's the draft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [lays down a bill]: I'm looking for a town called Mi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTENDER: You're not the first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTENDER: Had a bunch of TV news folks passin' through, nailed that baby-slasher up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Baby-slasher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTENDER: Yeah, hell of a week for us. The rodeo this we scumbag gets blown away. I hear it took thirty slugs to b sucker. Just goes to show you, don't it? People love a sp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's hit with a burst of emotion. She doesn't want the to see her cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Where's the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTENDER: Right around the corner there, darlin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori rises, exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori enters and leans on the sink as the grief hits her. stall door opens behind her: Sheryl, a girl in her early exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori pulls a tissue from her bag and tries to compose her standing back to allow Sheryl access to the mirror, where herself before starting to tease her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: Which is it, hon', men or money? [Lori looks at h usually one or the other, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Oh...[a tiny smile]...A man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: Uh-huh. What'd he do, leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: Jesus, did he come back? That's even worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In spite of herself, Lori's brightened by the girl's good

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL [cont.]: Some loser takes a shine to ya, you could 'em in the river tied to a piano he'll come back faster t with a bone. Thing is, why go to all this trouble to look there's nobody to admire the end product, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Can't argue with that, [likes her, feeling lonely] you a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: Hell, yes you can. Better than gettin' hit on by damn buffalo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori and Sheryl at the bar. Lori's nursing a beer. Sheryl fourth Black Russian and is getting friendlier by the mom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL [pause - just heard the story]: Lord. I have seen great lengths to walk out on a girl. But, I must say, I h heard tell of a fella doin' it while deceased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: They think some sick bastard's stole the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: So you want to go check out the place in which he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Yeah. Guess it's a way to say goodbye, you know? He a mystery to me. I loved him...[she looks away]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: Tell you what, Lori, why don't I drive up there t Medium place with you tomorrow and keep you company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: You don't have to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: Yeah, but I'm goin' to and I don't want no argume

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [smiles, grateful]: Okay. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: That's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [finishes her beer]: Guess I'll head up to my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: You get some rest, sugar. I'm gonna stay down her this damn bar. Maybe one of these lunkheads'll win the  lottery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori smiles, squeezes her hand, exits the bar. Sheryl loo finishes her drink. The bartender sets another drink down her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTENDER: Courtesy of that gent in the suit at the end o bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl looks down the bar, sees the man, seems impressed,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL [low, to the bartender]: Isn't he just the picture sophistication though?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We Cut to a wide shot of the Necropolis by night. A shoot falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we move in on one of the mausoleums, and from the gro we hear a ritualistic chanting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once within the darkness of the mausoleum the camera slid over the rock face into the depths of Midian. The volume chanting increases as we come close to its source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We come into the mural chamber, the camera passing down o family tree of Naturals and Nightbreed and round to see R Kinski approaching and entering the door of the initiatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to Narcisse and Boone, also approaching the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: You'll like this. No, really. It's just their w welcoming you to the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I'm not sure I want to be a member.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: You made your way back here for the same reason belong here now. There's nowhere else on earth would take us in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the chamber is a kind of font, on which bowl of Baphomet's blood, steaming and bubbling. Standing it is Lylesburg. To his side Peloquin. Beside him, Rachel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Lylesburg's other side, Ohnaka. Standing around the wa witnesses to the ceremony, are a variety of Breed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone enters. The Breed all look his way. Boone sees Shun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [to Narcisse in a whisper]: Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Shuna Sassi. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I dreamt her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shuna leans towards Peloquin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUNA SASSI: I've dreamt him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Narcisse nudges Boone forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Who is your advocate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Have you tutored him in the Law?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Yes he has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Let the advocate answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Yes I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: You understand what you do, becoming one of us night you turn your back on the Natural World. The life you lived will after this be as a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lylesburg takes the glove off his right hand. The flesh b cauterized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: The blood of the God tells all truths. It can easily as heal. Are you prepared to be judged?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lylesburg nods, and puts his hand into the bowl of the bl blood bubbles around his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cut to Peloquin and Shuna Sassi, who are watching Boon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone's eyes are now on Lylesburg's smoking hand as it ap Boone's chest, still marked by his wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Be judged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his hand on the bullet wounds. Boone stiffens. Bu no pain. When Lylesburg's hand is removed, the wounds hav There's a visible release of tension on the faces of all watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Aaron Boone, in the name of Baphomet, Lord of of the moon, I bid you welcome...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera moves out of the chamber, and towards the mura

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori lies awake in bed, staring at the ceiling. Outside, door, the noise of laughter and partying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [quietly, a tear in her eye]: I still love you, Boon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl is sitting at the empty bar, obviously hung over. wearing dark glasses and a horned Buffalo Days hat. The b pours her an eye-opener.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTENDER: Hair of the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: How's your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: My momma always used to say, 'Sheryl Ann, there's walking around with your name on his mind, all you got to into him.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: And he just happened to be checked in here at the c of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: Isn't that something? His name is Curtis, he is a recently divorced and recently relocated in Edmonton, up rodeo and better yet, he thinks I am the Queen-bee's knee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Sheryl, you sure you want to come along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: Wouldn't miss it. Besides, Curtis has to do busin we've got an engagement for this evening and if I sit around all day with this head on I'm gonna feel like the of a dog sled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I'm glad for your company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: Now if we could just make a quick stop for some A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's car comes to a stop near the edge of the reeds out Necropolis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: Jesus. Looks like the gold rush is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori parks the car. She gets out, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [quiet - reflective]: Why? Why would Boone come here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: To get away from it all? [Lori gives her a look] Sheryl Ann. You go do what you have to do. I'll stay here somethin' else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori nods and heads away down the street, leaving Sheryl car. She leans against the car, surveys the emptiness, wi enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL [cont.]: My luck, I'll end up buying some real est

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori - as she leaves the reeds and sees the outer walls o Necropolis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Good God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl - wandering from the car into the reeds. She light cigarette, tunelessly humming to ward off the willies. Sh shivers, suddenly feeling very isolated. The atmosphere's She starts back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She catches some movement out of the corner of her eye. S Slowly walks away from the movement, fighting off panic. turns a corner, and realizes she's lost in the reeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears movement behind her, turns, startled, then, odd smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL: Curtis ... what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Decker, looking like a commuter, hair slicked back, overcoat, carrying his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [big smile]: Hello, Sheryl Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori reaches the gates, slightly breathless. She pushes o open. The sun is hot and bright, transforming the Necropo dark, dangerous place it was when Boone was here. Now, wi gothic tombs and burgeoning plant life, it's almost welco

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori wanders the walkways, enchanted by the splendor of t There are strange, bittersweet sights along the way: stat sleeping on their masters' graves; of mourning mothers; o sitting at their graves. And grotesque images too: gargoy protecting the doorways of mausoleums; a tiger, roaring i is another world, solemn and silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except...suddenly, the sound of an animal in pain. Lori s looks around. Her gaze comes to rest on a spreading laure beneath which the shadows are pitch black. From here, the comes. She approaches. There is an animal beneath the tre discernible. She can see its flanks panting, its head mov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't look like a recognizable species, an amalgam o and deer. She approaches. It raises its head, weakly. Its huge and black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: ...It's okay, I won't hurt you...it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature shudders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: ...What's happened to you?...Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches beneath the branches and tentatively strokes It responds by dropping its head back on to the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: Oh God...you poor thing...don't die, please

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes beneath the tree, puts her arms beneath the cr picks it up. It is heavy, a dead weight in her arms. She from beneath the tree. As she steps back into the sun, th snarls and starts to wither in her arms. She realizes wha it pain and steps back into shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: You don't like the sun? Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of sobbing, off to her left, draws her attentio the mausoleum doors is open, and a woman, Rachel, dressed stands in the shadows, weeping. Lori's astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: I'm sorry...is, is it yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Bring her. Bring her, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shading the creature from the sun, Lori moves to the door into the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior is marble, the air murky. Rachel, a fine-bon Raphaelite beauty in her thirties, moves back against the nursing a wounded arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori looks down at the creature she's carrying, utterly l arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: ...I'm afraid it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: No...she can't die. Bring her to me, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel reaches out. Lori's reluctant to move further into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lori crosses the floor, she hears whispering from a st leads down into the earth. She stops, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Pay no attention. Please, bring me my Babette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the creature is named it starts to move in Lori's arms move, but change. Its claws grab at Lori's breast as it w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL [cont.]: Babette, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Don't look! Don't look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Lori can't help but look. Appalled, she tries to pull transforming creature off her, but its hold is firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Jesus! Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With effort, she detaches the creature's claws from her, throwing it at Rachel, who cradles the changing creature

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Babette...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori leans against the wall, trying to wipe the sticky fl creature's exuded onto her hands. When she looks up she s creature in Rachel's arms has transformed into a pale, be of seven or eight. Lori's dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: What...what...what the...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: She likes to play outside. I tell her: you mustn' the sun. The sun will hurt you. But she's just a child. S understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori looks back towards the open door, and the sun-drench outside. Then back at Babette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: This is too weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL [an urgent whisper]: You saved her. I owe you something...listen; I know why you came here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: You must go, this place is not for you. Midian is the Nightbreed. Only for the Nightbreed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Is Boone here? Did somebody bring him here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deep baritone voice rises up from the shadows of the st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Rachel...you have said too much already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lylesburg appears, a commanding, magisterial man with a v beard and three slits on each cheek that look like gills. along beside him, his fool, a muscular man with an innoce beautiful face: Ohnaka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: My Lylesburg, she brought me Babette, she saved h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: We know. But you cannot help her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [her spunk surfacing]: Look, I saved the child's lif deserve something for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: The child has no life to save, [he looks at he her up] But what she has is yours, if you want it. That's you want her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: No! I just want some answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: You weren't meant to see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I kind of got that impression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Then you also understand that to speak of this will bring dire consequences . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Hey, pal, don't threaten me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Not for you. For us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His words take the edge off Lori's anger. She notices tha in the marble arch above the doorway are the words:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG [cont.]: What's below remains below. This is th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is carrying Babette down the steps. Lylesburg turn her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Wait! Wait a minute! Boone, Aaron Boone, just tell here? You took him, you took his body, didn't you? Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori crosses to the stairs. Lylesburg's disappeared down darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: Talk to me, damn it, I have to know - come

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori heads down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Come back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lylesburg, Ohnaka, Rachel and Babette have gone, however. continues her descent. There are sounds in the darkness b She stops, and looks back towards the top of the stairs. way off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [to herself]: How deep does this go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads on down, turning a corner. In front of her, Pel starts towards her. She backs away, into a second creatur starts up the stairs. As she does so a third creature swi from the darkness above her head. She shrieks, and runs l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN [calls after her]: Come back soon, y'hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori emerges, squinting against the blinding sun, trying herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Okay. Walk away, Lori. Don't panic. There's got to perfectly reasonable explanation, [can't sustain it] And know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sprints back towards the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of breath, Lori reaches the car, parked where she lef sign of Sheryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Sheryl! Sheryl! Let's get the hell out of here! [no Sheryl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori looks around. Sees Sheryl's purse in the dirt near t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: Sheryl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves towards the reeds. Picks up the purse. Peers in house. She hears a gurgling laugh from inside. It could b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: Sheryl, come on ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The undergrowth is dark and empty. Lori advances cautious the paths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Sheryl, we have to go, uh, something's kind of come

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees a splash of blood on the reeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: Oh shit. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something moves across our field of vision in the gloom b She turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: Sheryl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back and follows the trail of blood around the Lying on the floor is Sheryl. Mouth cut away. Tongue cut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: Jesus! God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to run, but Decker steps into her path. He wear repulsive simplicity: a linen face with two buttons for e zipper [open at present] for a mouth. In his hands are tw carving knives, both blood-stained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Let's get it over with, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [mind racing, a survivor]: Take it easy, let's talk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [advancing]: Don't try and reason with me, Lori. I lunatic. You don't reason with lunatics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: How do you know my name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Good question. No reason why you shouldn't have a [he pulls off the mask] Wish I had a camera. Oh, the look

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Why? Why did you kill her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Why did I kill all the others? For the fun of it, For pleasure. Everyone ought to have a hobby, don't you a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Boone was innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Is innocent, wherever he's hiding. After all the went to to find him a home for his guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: You sick motherfucker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Boone's alive, Lori. And your death is going to b out of hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes at her suddenly, but his heel slides in Sheryl's falls in front of Lori, and stabs at her feet. She avoids an inch. He rises suddenly, throws one of his knives asid the blade Lori holds, with a glove which strikes sparks. chainmail. Lori lets go, propelling herself through the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light is diminishing behind the Necropolis walls. Lor are distant. We track towards the gate as she runs down t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Somebody help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flings the gate open and enters. Decker emerges from behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The temple is an impressive chamber, at the centre of whi dais, ringed with representatives of the six failed savio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the ring, a statue of Baphomet. There ar along the walls. Sitting in them, reciting in soft, sibil the Laws of Midian, are Breed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lylesburg, accompanied by Ohnaka, is also in the chamber, Boone, being held by the Breed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I have to help her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: You can't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I'll kill him. No-one will ever know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: What's below remains below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I can't let her die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: When we took you in you made an oath to obey t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I won't listen to him butcher her. I love her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: She's a Natural. She couldn't love you back. N

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Wrong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to struggle against his captors, fighting them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: You're wrong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throwing one back, and punching the other, Boone breaks f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Boone! Boone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lylesburg's shout is ignored, as Boone heads up to the su

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori runs down the walkways pursued by Decker, her breath gasps, close to collapse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Help me! Oh please, God, somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori collapses. Decker reaches her and pulls on his mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: That's good. Be still. It's quicker that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a particularly nasty blade from his jacket inter advances. She rises and tries to duck the cut. He strikes the back of his hand. She falls, striking her head on a t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [cont.] [sudden fury]: I said, be still!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori is semi-conscious, blood running from her wounded he past Decker, she sees something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Boone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker laughs. Then he realizes she's reacting to the app Boone, standing in the shadows behind him, in jeans and l jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori slips into unconsciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: You? Here again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Isn't this where the dead are supposed to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: You're not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [advancing]: You're wrong. We're both dead, Decker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: I'm not Decker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: No? Isn't that you, Dr Decker, hiding behind that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: I'm not hiding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [still advancing, taunting him]: Decker, Decker. Do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, Decker throws the knife; it buries in the middle chest. Decker laughs, then stops, as Boone pulls the knif tosses it aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [cont.]: Blades are no better than bullets, Decker, get it? I'm dead. The walking dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: That's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker turns to run, but Boone races to him, catches, tur and pulls Decker closer, until they're nose to nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Not just dead...changed. A monster. Want me to sho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [whimpering]: No, please ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Not your kind of monster. Not the soulless kind. I Midian in my veins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tears off the mask, uncovering Decker's sweaty, terrif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Please, please, it's, it's not my fault, it's the makes me do things I don't want to...[Boone pulls him clo it was the mask and they were going to find me, punish me scapegoat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: You chose the wrong man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [V.O.]: Man? You call yourself a man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone looks round; Narcisse is squatting on a tomb, his f of scar tissue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [cont.]: You're no more man than I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Monster, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: That's more like it. [he jumps off the tomb, mo them] Well, go on, are you going to kill him or not? Only balls. And his eyes. That is, if you don't want them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I'll pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Remember me, Doctor? I was dying when you had y with me. You made me tell my secrets when I was feeling p vulnerable. Now was that a nice thing for a doctor to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [to Boone, craven]: Oh God, Boone, don't let him t anything, keep him off me, full confession...sweet Jesus, mercy, please, I'm begging you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Narcisse raises his thumbs, still bearing their silver ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Let's start with his eyes ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone pushes Narcisse back, but as he does so Decker slip grasp. Boone roars and starts to twitch and stamp as Pelo we watch as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone transforms into something part man, part carnivore. chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker nears the gate, but Boone is after him at great sp leaping over tombs like a high-jumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left behind, Narcisse turns his eyes upon the recumbent L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [filled with hunger, greatly consoled): Well...y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he advances on her, Lori's eyes flicker open. She scre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone right on Decker's tail; he hears Lori's screams and Decker runs out through the gate. Boone starts back towar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori struggling in Narcisse's arms. He tries to muffle he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone leaps tombs, nearing their location. He bounds into clearing, sees Lori unconscious in Narcisse's embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Let her go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Narcisse, all sheepish co-operation, gently lets her go o ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Just...keeping her warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone is almost human now. He reaches Lori.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [cont.]: I wouldn't have touched her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone breathes in the last of his monstrous condition, an tenderly stroke Lori's face. Then, very lightly, he kisse gathers her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I had no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: You've put us all in danger for your love of t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Decker can't tell anyone. What's he going to say? he tried to kill a girl and a dead man stopped him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: He can still lead our enemies here. If he goes Midian's unearthed В— you're responsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: So let me make amends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Just take the girl and go on your way amongst Naturals. That's the Law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Who made this Law?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Baphomet. The God in Obsidian. Who made Midian

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: So maybe I should speak to this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Baphomet is a spirit in stone. He doesn't spea His wounds are too great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: What are you afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: What Baphomet made he has the power to unmake. is volatile. He mustn't be angered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Then I'll make nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone heads down the corridor. He slows as he passes an e one side chamber and looks in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the chamber, a dog-faced man is working on a vast mosaic mural that extends into shadow in both directions. and locks eyes with Boone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone breaks off the contact and continues down the corri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog-faced man turns back to his palette; a multi-colo collection of small tiles. He carefully selects a few, th the mosaic and we see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mosaic mural. Prominent in what appears to be a panor history of the Nightbreed race, is a heroic figure who cl resembles...Boone. The dog-faced man applies the tiles he filling in the irises of the Boone-figure's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Boone...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her head aches. She winces. Babette goes to her aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE: Be still. It was a bad hurt he did us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Us? What do you mean 'us'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL [moving to them]: You held Babette while she trans She's made quite a bond with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE: I felt your hurt. I still feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: She even knew you were coming here. She saw it al your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE: And you can see through mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [pause - she tries to read Rachel]: You're not kiddi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: It's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori rises unsteadily to her feet. Babette takes her hand Rachel moves her away from Lori.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL [cont.]: She doesn't want you to touch her, sweet. afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: You got that right. One minute I'm about to get car Christmas turkey, the next I'm...I'm...[a surfacing memor train]...God...it was Boone...Boone saved me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: But he's dead, I saw him in the morgue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
