dialogues.text: RACHEL: You still don't understand, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Wait a second, back up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: You're below now. With the Nightbreed. The last s the great tribes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Tribes of who? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: We're shapeshifters; freaks; remains of races you have almost driven to extinction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: So you're not immortal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Far from it. The sun can kill some of us. Like Ba follows her father in that. Some of us could be shot down would survive that because they've got beyond death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Horrible. It's all horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: To be able to fly? To be smoke, or a wolf; to kno night, and live in it forever? That's not so bad. You cal monsters, but when you dream, it's of flying and changing living without death. You envy us. And what you envy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [softly; understanding]: ...We destroy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL [to Babette]: Show her. Show her the past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babette touches Lori's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE: Be with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skulls in front of Lori fill her sight. We fly throug the eye sockets into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fade through from the skull chamber into grinning people towards partially constructed bonfires...The people throw the fires...We track off the fire-building to a wall, beh frightened monsters hide...The shadow of a cross falls on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inquisitors in black robes part to reveal the Head Inquis purple robes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reads the charges...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEAD INQUISITOR: Thou shalt not suffer a monster to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frightened monsters pulled away from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inquisitors step aside to show torture scenes. We track t tortures: racks, crucifixion, floggings, a hanging. The c off gallows, past a wall to flags. We cut close on the fl reads FREAK SHOW, track past the flag to a cage, containi Breed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well-dressed ordinary men and women applaud and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the freaks is dragged from the cages. He looks bac family he's left behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inquisitor reads their charges, as the bonfire awaits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Victim is thrown onto the bonfire. A tinder flares, a inquisitors and audience light cigarettes and cigars from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bonfire then flares up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An inquisitor lasciviously strokes the naked buttocks of girl. She turns towards us in despair; we see her head is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overwhelmed with horror, Lori opens her eyes, breaking he connection with Babette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: We are all that remain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: And...and you're saying...Boone's like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: He is Nightbreed. Or he was, until he broke the L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [moving towards the door]: No, no, that's not possib I've got to find him, there's been some kind of mistake..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE: Don't go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: But he didn't kill anybody, it wasn't him, he's inn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: That no longer matters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Where is he? Where'd he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Down to the Tabernacle, to Baphomet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: The Baptiser. Who made Midian. Who called us here and saved us from our enemies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Take me there, I've got to find Boone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: It's forbidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: We'll see about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker is drinking coffee. A cop strides by. Joyce enters

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Decker? This better be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: I found Boone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Someone brought the corpse down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: He's not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: I saw him pumped full of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: So did I. But he's alive. He killed again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: In Shere Neck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: No, out at Midian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Why'd he go back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eigerman enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: What are you doing in my office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE: This is Inspector Joyce. Calgary Police Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: We don't need any city boys on the case. Midian jurisdiction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: We can work together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: No we don't. I'll bring him in myself. This is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: He's not alone anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Yeah. I heard that talk. That's nuthouse talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Talk about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Midian's not empty. There's something breeding th the cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE [to Decker]: Do you believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Yes I do. And if you don't stop them there's goin more bloodshed. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori finds herself in a cavernous space, lined with chamb connected by walkways and ladders, which don't look parti secure. She moves out on to a walkway. It leads her into core of Midian, which offers a view of dizzying descent i earth. She scans the scene, amazed by the sheer scale of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: My God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she descends into the bowels of Midian, creatures in v doorways watch her with curiosity. One creature seems to running from wounds on its body. Another tumbles past her acrobat, defying gravity. She sees only a few of these bu more, chattering and murmuring in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lori moves through the chambers toward Peloquin we see creature Lude feeding snakes to his pet, a horned, many l which squats on the floor. He gets up and goes to look at a grinning grotesque, appears from the back of the chambe the snake from the maw of the pet, and comes to watch as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEROY [eating the snake]: There goes the neighbourhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori looks into a chamber. A dark, winged figure moves as reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ceremony, with the bowls of white blood later seen in B chamber, is in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lori crosses the bridge something watches from the dee shadows...the tone darkens. She steps off the bridge and scuttle away. Lori is now a little nervous. She finds her corner with several doors...Through one door she sees a m white T-shirt. She calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Boone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori enters through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a corner a ghastly meal is underway. The Boone figure away through another door. Lori follows the figure, and t get up as if to attack. In the next chamber is a tangle o glistening bodies with no heads...Lori glances round. The pursue her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead of Lori is the Boone figure. She approaches it a out of the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not Boone!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red beast is rising behind her. Lori turns and exits chamber, flattening herself against the rock. She advance in a niche above where she's walking, we see a small liza creature, Barabas, eating a dead rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori enters the final chamber, following the figure she t Boone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the far side, crouching at a door, a figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Boone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure turns. It's Peloquin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: No-one here of that name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns. The Boone figure is in the doorway behind her. face of a snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: Told you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches Lori.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: I know you. He talks about you. Lori.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches a broach from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: Nice. You're still a Natural. Want to join the goes to bite her]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peloquin follows her to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN [at door]: You will. Sooner or later you'll want forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs maniacally, returning into his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori continues her descent. As she nears the cavern floor steps into her path, beside him his fool, Ohnaka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: You may go no further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I want Boone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: You're not to blame, but you must understand: Boone's done has put us in jeopardy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: No problem, you tell me where he is and we're outta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Boone has gone to Baphomet. He is beyond recal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low rumbling issues from somewhere deep inside the pass Lylesburg stands before. Underneath the rumble is an anim moaning with pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Where is he? He's down here isn't he? You want to s you're gonna have to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressed by her resolve, Lylesburg stands aside. She mov and heads down into the chamber, towards a distant light. gestures after her. Ohnaka nods and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori heads through a room which leads towards the Berserk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reassuring sounds of the Core fade behind her. She sl advance. Suddenly, Narcisse steps from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Up and about already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Keep away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: I'm sorry about upstairs. I see a pretty face a to kiss it. [Lori moves on past] Don't go down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [instant change of subject]: Don't you just love place? Shangri-La on dope. I love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: What's that smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [sniffs his armpits]: Not me. They keep the Bers there. Mad bastards. They'll rip your head off and shit d neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Boone went this way, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: And won't be coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I'll bring him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: You think love can raise the dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: He's not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: He's that and more. If you don't believe me, yo he gets to sniff a little blood. That'll bring out the be I'm telling you, don't go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I have to. Nothing makes any sense without him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Sense? Who needs it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori moves off down the corridor. Ohnaka follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [to Ohnaka]: Love those tattoos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori starts down the corridor, the walls of which are cra in places, the gaps covered with chains. From the other s hears grunts and growls. Then, to her shock, one of the B arms reaches up from a grille in the floor and snatches a She steps aside to avoid it, and another of the Berserker reaches through the mesh of chains, taking hold of her by It starts to choke her. She shouts for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohnaka, Lylesburg's fool, appears from down the corridor. to rattle the chains further along the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OHNAKA: Hey, Ghost! Hey, Slaughter! Come and get me! Come and get me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The arm around Lori's neck releases its hold, and we hear of the creatures moving along the walls in Ohnaka's direc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OHNAKA: Fat-asses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, arms reach for him through the chains. He steps in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OHNAKA: Missed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins at Lori, proud of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Where's Boone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OHNAKA: This way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to lead her towards Baphomet's chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohnaka and Lori reach the next to last chamber; a roaring below, down a slope in front of them, walls vibrating wit from Baphomet's chamber. Ohnaka withdraws. Blindingly bri out of which Lori spots a figure climbing towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Boone? Boone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves down to Boone, scrambling up the slope towards drenched in sweat, half-mad with terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Don't...don't look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for her, then collapses. She starts down the s him. Dust falls from the roof, the din makes her reel. Bu reaches him, starts to haul him to his feet. Then, she lo we get a glimpse of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the blinding light, and seemingly the source of it black figure turns towards her, twelve feet high, severed connected by sinews of hot, white energy and extruded spi face terrible, wise and beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's stunned, she averts her eyes. Boone collects himse to pull her away and they help each other frantically scr slope, out of the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lori and Boone emerge, Ohnaka appears and beckons them Too exhausted and frightened to speak, Boone and Lori follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ominous rumblings urge them on, as Boone and Lori make a ascent through the core, trailing Ohnaka's urgent lead, w the doorways by a variety of creatures. We cut to the led to a chamber, where Peloquin and Shuna Sassi are making l Peloquin hears Lori urging Boone on as they struggle acro bridge, and looks away from Shuna, out through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: Well, well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN [cont.]: Guess he couldn't take the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUNA SASSI: I dreamt him. He's strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: That's only because the bite was mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUNA SASSI: No, don't you see? He's the one from the pro Cabal. The seventh saviour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: So why's he leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUNA SASSI: Everything has its purpose. Maybe he hasn't hate his tribe enough. He'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peloquin kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: Why die waiting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun climbs over the horizon, sunlight penetrates the A mausoleum door creaks open, Lori and Boone rush out int air. Lori tries to lead Boone away, he squints painfully early light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: No, no, I belong here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [grabs him]: Bullshit! Boone, Boone, listen to me - with me, that's why you lived, that's why we survived, because we belong together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohnaka swings the door shut behind them. Boone sees Lori, the first time. She takes his hand, presses it to her fac breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: This is me. This is why I followed you, thi we're living for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes clear. A part of him seems to return. He embrace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Lori...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: They don't need you. Nobody needs you but me. We'll far away, where no-one will ever find us. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hold each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone and Lori - two small figures, alone among the sepul move towards the gate together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty streets. No activity. Lori's car pulls into the par

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori turns to Boone, slumped down in the passenger seat, sight, wearing sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I'll get my stuff, I'll be back in two minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Don't leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Boone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [fiercely]: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [calmly В— trying to hide her alarm]: Okay. We'll go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him the Buffalo Days hat and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a phone booth across the street we see Lori and Boon towards the motel entrance. In foreground, a chain-mailed up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone and Lori enter the corridor that leads to her room. silence, save for a dog yapping somewhere. Boone stops. A turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [whispers]: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Why is it so empty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: They must be at the rodeo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries on, Boone follows, clearly disturbed. Lori un door, glancing back at Boone, who has taken off his sungl is something strange about the light in his eyes. A subtl colour passes across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I smell blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: So much blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swings the door open. We expect a horror. Nothing. An room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori enters and quickly gathers her belongings together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone, sweating with terror, slides down the wall into a position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lori packs, she looks down, sees a hole in the wall, t of some massive violence from the other side. She cautiou down, peers through the hole and quickly retreats, hand o horrified by what she's seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Boone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone appears at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI[cont.]: Next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone goes next door and turns the handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone pushes the door open. Inside, a massacre: five dead players, propped up around a poker table in a sick parody game tableau; throats slit, Buffalo Hats on their heads. the middle of the table, a tall, elaborate house of cards

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone moves into the middle of the room. On his face we c hunger he feels. Ripples of color begin to move over his moves towards the corpses...as he does so, we hear a near sound from outside...the vibrations knock over the house and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the empty street, a helicopter descends, discharging Joyce and a platoon of heavily armed Swat Team cops. Loca cars pour in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Eigerman climbs out of his cruiser to survey the Decker introduces him to Joyce. Sharpshooters take up pos training their weapons on the motel, as the Swat Team mov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori moves to the door of the murder room. Boone is insid to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: It was Decker...Decker did this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In foreground, Boone's face begins to transform, which Lo see. She hears the cops outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: Boone, we have to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Stay away from me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Boone, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I don't want you to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: See what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Get out! Do as I say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I won't leave you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she crosses towards him, he turns. His face is in mid- transformation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's scream echoes outside the motel. Joyce orders in t Team. They charge, entering the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori backs out of the room in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Oh my God...oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears cops charging up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [cont.]: Boone! They're coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transformed Boone covers his face, slams the room doo moves towards the bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori hides at the end of the corridor as the Swat cops ap far end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his knees, in the middle of some frenzied action we ca see, Boone stops and looks down at his blood-stained hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: No...No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of sight, Lori watches the cops prepare to storm the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone enters the bathroom with the sound of the Swat Team the motel on the track. He slams the door. There is blood and hands. He goes to the sink and turns on the tap. Then himself in the mirror, his transformed face is a shock, H himself, appalled. Then a wave of nausea overtakes him. H into the sink; a splash of blood and flesh he's just eate his mouth with the back of his hands he starts to breathe condition. His face transforms back to his normal state. sob of horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT LEADER (V.O.): In here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone looks towards the door, sinking down against the ti does so. The door is flung open. We see him cowering as t come for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under cover of the trees and cars around the motel, Lori place where she can view the front of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Eigerman talking with Joyce, Decker behind them. up as the Swat cops manhandle a hand-cuffed Boone out of building. He has totally reverted to human form, the bloo seemingly a sure proof of guilt. Lori watches as he's thr police car and driven off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clank of keys opening locks. A steel door swings open. rough-house Boone down the corridor, Eigerman right behin other cells holding prisoners watching them go by. We hol young fundamentalist Baptist preacher, Reverend Ashberry. haunted, maniacally repressed eyes and the ragged look of drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone is thrown into the cell. Eigerman and the three cop Labowitz, Sergeant Pettine and Gibbs, all practised hard the cell after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Fuckin' freak! Fuckin' cannibal! [to his men] S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haul Boone to his feet. Eigerman hits Boone with a w blackjack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN [cont.]: You picked the wrong town, boy. We beli justice here, [a blow is delivered] They're gonna take yo the city...[another blow]...but we're gonna leave you with something...[another blow]...to remember...[another]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone sags to the ground, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sound of Boone being beaten up filters through the Ashberry sits in his cell, Bible in hand. He flicks the p attempting to distance himself from the violence he hears He halts at a page with an illustration. It is something Revelations: monsters and demons doing battle with angels the book down, and turns over his palm. It is a mass of t He closes his hand into a white-knuckled fist, retreating shadows in the corner of his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cutback to his hand. Blood seeps between the fingers, nails dig into the meat of his palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eigerman enters. Decker is standing looking at Eigerman's of photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: You still here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: I'm going back to Midian with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: I'm not going anywhere. We got press folks and photographers coming in from all over. Wouldn't be polite waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eigerman starts to exit again. Joyce is in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Tell him. We got our man under lock and key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Don't trust him. He...he...changes. I've seen him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: I'll keep an eye out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: He was right about the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: So maybe there are more of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Monsters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Killers. A cult. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: You want to take some of the boys, take 'em Pet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE: Yes, Sir -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: You, Tommy and Gibbs, take the Inspector out to cemetery. Dig around. If you find anything with more two holler. I got photographers wanting me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badly beaten, Boone lies in the corner, stirring when he door unlocked. Labowitz ushers in a middle-aged, small-to physician, Doctor Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LABOWITZ: Doctor's here to examine you, freak. Just so no say we laid a finger on you...[he winks at Rose] Looks ok what do you think, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone painfully pulls himself upright. Looks up at Dr Ros slips on his stethoscope, listens to Boone's chest. He mo listens, moves it again, alarmed. He takes Boone's wrist, around. Boone stares at him. Dr Rose clears his throat, r to Labowitz at the door and speaks quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR ROSE: No pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LABOWITZ: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR ROSE: No...pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd of journalists and on-lookers mill outside the st find Lori, following her through the crowd as she tries t of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she watches, Joyce and his three-cop escort climb into cars and drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An impromptu press conference, with Eigerman centre stage at a table laced with tape recorders and microphones. Behind him, a map of the town, with coloured pins and a b drawing of the Sweetgrass Inn, including a diagram of whe bodies were found. Eigerman adores the attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Yes he may have had accomplices but I can't rev precise source of my information on that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1ST REPORTER: Local source, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN [a glance at Decker in the crowd]: Not so's you'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2ND REPORTER: Has Boone made a confession?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: We found him with a piece of human flesh in his How's that for guilty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameras flash furiously. We see Labowitz leading Dr Rose crowd to the podium. Labowitz reaches Eigerman and whispe ear. Eigerman makes him repeat it. His brow knits in puzz turns to the press and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN [cont.]: 'Scuse me, folks, won't be a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eigerman points a beckoning finger at Decker, who follows his office, along with Labowitz and Dr Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eigerman closes the door and turns to Decker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Just exactly how many bullets did they put into up at Midian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR ROSE [severely shaken]: Half of them are still in him. he's riddled with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: As I told you, these aren't ordinary people. You' he should be dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR ROSE: No, I'm saying he is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Not lying down dead, friend. Walkin' around in cell dead. Now what about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker's shaken. He grips his briefcase tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone sits in his cell, head down, expression masked, eye restlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashberry is sitting half in shadow and half in light. His the half-buried mania that we'll see erupt later on. He p against the wall and speaks softly to Boone, his tone int his feelings take stronger hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY: Can you hear me? They'll find a way to kill you that? Can't fight the darkness. Not when it's inside you. Are you listening? You're an abomination, Boone. You die. There's lots of ways. I've read about them. Seen the sleep. Horrible. HEAR ME?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly slams his bloody hand against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY: Have you got a God, Boone? Any God'll do. I had but...he doesn't listen any more. I ask him to take the dreams away but they keep coming. Blood and fire. Like th the world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move from Ashberry's stricken face to the bloody mark left in the wall. It vaguely resembles something we recog Baphomet's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori emerges from a supermarket with food to eat. She wal small square, finds a seat and sits down to eat. As she r the bag:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE[V.O.]:Lori?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks round. The voice sounded real. No sign of Babet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE [V.O. - cont.]: Lori...close your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [frightened]: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE [V.O.]: Please, do as I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE [V.O.]: Be with me...be with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim light. We're in the Midian skull chamber, seeing it t Babette's eyes. Their voices merge into one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI/BABETTE [V.O.]: ...where am I? What's happening to m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel steps into view, and looks directly down at the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: What is it, child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's eyes spring open. She's terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE [V.O.]: Lori! Comeback!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori closes her eyes again and we click back into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - we see Babette's view of Rach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI/BABETTE [V.O.]: Is this real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL [whispers]: What are you talking about? Babette? [ Babette] What have you done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI/BABETTE [V.O.]: I've brought her, to see. She's in m breaks away, Rachel tries to catch hold, Babette runs. P.O.V. camera veers around and down through the maze of M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes closed on the bench, Lori gasps as the journey snatc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - Babette races over a rope-bri it all through her eyes, her hands coming occasionally in head down a narrow tunnel and into a small chamber, which Babette's hidehole. We scan the treasures she keeps there made of grasses; birds' skulls; pretty stones. We hear vo above and we look up at a steel grille, facing out on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pushing closer to the grille we see...Joyce, Pettine, Tom Gibbs, wandering through the Necropolis, armed to the hil Joyce carries no weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE: Christ, you could hide a fuckin' army in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY: What egg-zactly are we lookin' for, Sarge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY [spits some tobacco juice on a tomb]: We're here to major-league butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE [distrusts these throwbacks]: We're here to scout,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY: Well what if they engage us? What about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE: There's people down there, I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori/Babette gasps, Pettine hears the sound and walks ove grille.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY: Why don't we just shoot 'em in their graves? Save diggin' new ones, [giggles - fires at one of the tombs]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE [angry]: Hold your fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE: We want prisoners, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pettine goes down on his haunches beside the grille, runs of his gun along it. P.O.V. camera withdraws into the shadows. He shakes his head and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cut out of the P.O.V. as Pettine stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE: There's something down there all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: If that's the case we'll call for back-up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pettine spots a movement in the shadows of a half-open ma door. He catches Gibbs' eye, nods in the direction of the gets the idea and starts to back towards the tomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE [a performance]: I don't know. Maybe we're just s Hell, who'd live in a graveyard, anyway? [crossing toward What do you say, Lieutenant? Maybe we oughta just pack it for home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Gibbs rush the door of the tomb; there's a cry of from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - Camera glides back up to the time to see Gibbs and Pettine drag Ohnaka out of darkness the sunlight where he lacks the strength to resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY: Well, lookee what we got here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy strikes Ohnaka with a rifle butt, knocking him to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cops circle around Ohnaka, he moans, puts his head covers his face with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIBBS: Shit. Don't look so tough to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE: Want we should interrogate it, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE [amazed]: Give it some room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the sunlight, Ohnaka's naked back begins to smoke and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIBBS: What the hell for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: God damn it! There's something wrong with him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY [disgusted]: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE: What the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs, unfazed, steps up to Ohnaka and kicks the creature

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIBBS: We want answers, asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Back off, Gibbs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs ignores him, trying to drag Ohnaka's hands away fro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - Watching the knot of men arou defenceless Ohnaka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI/BABETTE [V.O.]: The light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs rifle-butts Ohnaka's hands, then pulls them away fr face; the features are horribly disfigured, blood running eyes, scorched by the sun. Now even Gibbs tries to back a Ohnaka grabs hold of his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIBBS: Shit! Shit! Get it off me! Tommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY: No way, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pettine fires his piece at Ohnaka, hitting him in the bel but he still holds on, throwing back his head and howling rises from his entire body, dust pours from his veins. Th becomes a high-pitched whine and he explodes, in a burst black blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - They see Ohnaka die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori opens her eyes, which are running with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Oh my God...oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up, her hand to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - Babette's trembling hands hol grille as she watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE [V.O.]: Lori, don't leave, please don't leave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops stare in disbelief at Ohnaka's dusty remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE: Jesus...d'you see that fucker's face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: It was the sun. The sun did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIBBS: Christ on a crutch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Man, that tears it, I'm calling the fuckin' chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs raises a trembling match to his cigarette as Tommy to the cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIBBS: Couldn't have been just...just the sun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Believe it, shithead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE [grinning]: So if all it takes is the sun, we got perfect weapon, right over our heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Until it goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pettine's smile fades. Then a cry of alarm from the dista

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY [V.O.]: Oh no! Shit! Pettine! Goddamn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men rush to the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two police cars are on fire. The other cops reach the reaches into the one less involved in flame and pulls out microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Who did it, did you see anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy shakes his head. They all look up, hearing a distan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing a hat and dark glasses, laughing, Narcisse drives clunker like a maniac, takes a large cigar out of his mou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strikes a match off a thumb hook and lights up. In the protected from sunlight by shades on the windows, is Rach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens, a panicked Labowitz enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LABOWITZ: Chief, come quick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN [from inside a stall]: This better be good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LABOWITZ: Pettine's on the radio, they're under attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Hot damn, we got contact!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bursts out of the stall, hitching his trousers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eigerman enters, takes the two-way receiver. Behind him, Labowitz and Kane enter the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Pettine, what's your situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pettine on the radio, as the others try to keep back the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE [into radio]: The place is crawling with 'em...th our cars...fuckin' freaks!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transmission breaks up. Eigerman turns to the others

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN [joyfully]: ...Sound the call, boys, let the bel freedom ring, we got to mobilize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker affectionately runs his hand over his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori moves down the street, blinking through tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE [V.O.]: I'm afraid ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I have to go, Babette, I have to get help. I'll be promise. You hide somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The connection fades. Lori wipes the tears from her cheek

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd and journalists still hanging around; Eigerman door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Listen up! We got officers under attack, I need for a posse! Y'all sign up with Officer Labowitz here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves back towards the office, as Labowitz, clipboard besieged with offers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker is sitting with his briefcase open on his lap, gaz

dialogues.speaker: AFFECTIONATELY
dialogues.text: at the button head mask inside. He snaps the case shut as re-enters, followed by the silent Kane. Eigerman digs a k out of his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: If you're gonna make an omelette you have to br isn't that right, Professor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [doesn't follow]: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Christmas comes early this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eigerman leads Decker, Kane and another cop down into the the station. He unlocks a door and switches on a light. W inside is a virtual arsenal in a number of packing crates with a martial insignia and the name:

dialogues.text: The crates are also stamped with their countries of origi Africa and the Soviet Union.

dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Ounce a' prevention is worth a pound a' cure. S rainy day, one day that day will come. Don't matter if it homos, freaks or Japs, we are ready. World class ordnance best private sector money can buy.

dialogues.text: Kane, with a clipboard, goes over supplies with the other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE [over above В— in his element): Okay. We got your sp G3 thirty-odd-six Springfield semi-auto with roller-lock action and retractable stock. For standard carbine firepo can't beat this match-accurate Galil AR 7.62 NATO assault for the sportsman in the crowd we carry this handy, doubl Mossberg Persuader, sling swivels double extractors, whic in a light-weight single-barrel size for ladies and junio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Marvelous, really, but -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE: Now over here we're talkin' Damascus, high-carbon S shootin' knives, and for that tough up-close-and- personal work, you can always count on your razor-wire/fi garotte when nuthin' else will do В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [over Kane]: Captain, have you considered the poss that knives and bullets won't be adequate to the task?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Show him, Kane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE [pulling off a shroud to unveil]: That's why we boug cherry Israeli Army high-octane linear-field flame throwe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Now I know what you're thinkin', Doc; maybe the sort'a spiritual angle to all this. Well, we got that covered, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cell door swings open. Decker and Eigerman look in on t preacher, Reverend Ashberry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Reverend Ashberry, your services are required.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: He looks like a drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: He is; lost his way, poor bastard, [hauling Ash his feet] You wouldn't wanna miss the Day of Judgment, no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY [seems he's been waiting for this]: The Apocalyp here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: They're warming up for it over in Midian. [lead out] Padre, you get your pious butt over to church and lo some Holy Water and crucifixes...we're goin' in there wit side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone looks out the window of his cell as a large, unruly musters outside in a variety of vehicles. A mix of surviv fanatics in Sons of the Free-labelled camouflage, Marlbor six-shooters, red-neck bozos with their diesel-dyke mamas made-up bimbos out for a good time. The atmosphere is one carnival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accoutred for combat, Kane and some other cops distribute

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone slumps away from the window, his worst fears realiz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Ashberry arrives, lugging six full canteens and of crucifixes. He loads into the back of an enclosed, hig camper with Eigerman and Decker. Eigerman blows an air-ho the crowd's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: You are all hereby deputized in the name of the let's kick some ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eigerman's truck leads the caravan, which drives off, hor war whoops and liquor-fuelled courage. As the dust clears more or less alone, Lori looks at the police station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat-up car squeals to a halt in front of her and the f opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Hey, chickie, want a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori sees Rachel and gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Narcisse drives around the block, smoking his cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: We have to get Boone out, Midian needs him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: What could he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: He went into Baphomet's chamber. He spoke with th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: And survived; nobody ever did that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Perhaps Baphomet told him something, something th save Midian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Where they keeping him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Inside somewhere. He'll be guarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: He has powers of his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Tell me about it; what's happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: He was bitten by a Nightbreed, see, the taint's system...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Boone has been turned, he's one of us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Okay. So what you're saying is, you're saying he's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Hey, some of my best friends are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [horrified]: ...I'm going out of my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [to Rachel]: See? I told you she'd take it well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse heads down the road, whoops and hollers emergin dust cloud it kicks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eigerman cleans his silver-plate Magnum .45, Decker sits holding his briefcase, across from Ashberry, who's franti through an ancient Bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Ever performed an exorcism, Father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Ever seen one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Well I'd start rehearsin' if I was you. [hands towards Decker] Why don't you hang on to that, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER [a little prim]: Oh no, I wouldn't know how to use

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY [finds something in the book, reads]: Listen! 'S spoke to the people, saying "Arm yourselves for war and l and take vengeance for the Lord on Midian..." and so they fire all the cities where they dwelt and killed the kings of Midian, both man and beast!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN [with a wink]: Hey, how 'bout that, Doc? Sounds on a crusade against the Devil himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY [not terribly convincing]: I don't believe in th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Oh...you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashberry looks at Decker; no trace of irony in his expres Ashberry sorts through the canteens, finds the one that d a white cross on it, opens it and knocks back two fingers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun sinking low in the sky. The shadows are long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station is eerily quiet. Labowitz and an Irish cop, C Cormack, guard the cells. Two other cops patrol the end o corridor. All heavily armed. Labowitz moves to the door o cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spy-hole cover is open. Boone looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LABOWITZ [from other side of door]: Hey, freak-face, we f pals. They're gonna fry, just like you. Give us a smile n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone stares at the floor, depressed, defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Labowitz chuckles and closes the spy-hole. He walks back coffee station near Eigerman's office, where Cormack is p cups. He takes out a flask, spikes his mug and offers som Labowitz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORMACK: Little Irish in your joe, Constable Labowitz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LABOWITZ [a bad brogue]: Don't mind if I do, Constable Co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a knock on the station door. They look at each o Cormack picks up his gun and crosses to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORMACK: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL [O.S.]: Help me, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORMACK: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL [O.S.]: Accident. We need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cormack decides to unbolt the door. On the step stands Ra shrouded in black veils. Only her eyes are visible. They Cormack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORMACK: What's the problem, lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops the veil. The other half of her face has disapp smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORMACK [cont.]: What the blazes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her costume falls to the ground. Her eyes dissolve. As sm blows into the station. Cormack fires through the smoke, he does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LABOWITZ [running towards the cell]: Hold 'em, Connie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two other cops hear the shot and run towards the stat Labowitz runs back in with them before they get there, sl bolts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LABOWITZ [to the other cops]: Hold your ground! [yells th door] Cormack? You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cormack turns back towards the door, sees Narcisse, screa fires twice. Narcisse flips one of the bullets out of his a thumb-nail, then leaps onto Cormack, who manages to sho in the foot. Lori enters, slams the door and locks it. Na squats over Cormack, holds his razor-nails under his chin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Where is he? Where's Boone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORMACK: Cell f-f-f-five...through the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [grins at Lori]: I love a coward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Labowitz and the other cops confidently prepare for a sie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LABOWITZ [calling back to Boone]: Don't think you're gett freak. No way they get through that door; solid steel, armour-piercing shells wouldn't even make a dent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke seeps through the key-hole, and from beneath the co door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LABOWITZ [cont.]: You hear me, freak? No fuckin' way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smoke from the key-hole begins to form into a face, w on a cord of smoke/flesh from the key-hole. The smoke fro the door forms into breasts and rib cage, in which a hear Labowitz turns and sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LABOWITZ [cont.]: Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He empties his gun through the smoke; the two cops on the of the smoke are hit and go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An arm moves towards Labowitz; so does Rachel's face. Her mesmerizes him. Her naked breasts, which float beneath the head, barely connected to it as yet, enchant him even

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Come closer...I don't want to kill you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hand presses Labowitz's rifle aside. Rachel's lips to doesn't resist, but once his mouth is sealed against hers breathe. He tries to raise the rifle, but she dashes it f hand. Then she snatches the keys from his belt and breaks He falls to his knees, gasping. Her body completed and na unlocks the connecting door, then starts looking for Boon her, as Labowitz reaches for his gun, Narcisse's hand rea grabs his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Naughty, naughty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Labowitz looks up into Narcisse's scarred face and faints steps past Labowitz to the cell Rachel directs her toward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: We don't have much time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori unlocks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [nervous]: Boone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [wakes]: Stay away from me. I'll hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: You know what I did in that room? I'm a goddamn ca Stay away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: They're going to come for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Let them. Let them find some way to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: You can't die. Midian needs you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Midian's just a hole in the ground. It's full of t should lie down and stay dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: All right. If not for the Breed, then for me. You c up on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: You talk like you're one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Maybe I wish I was. Some little part of me. [she pu on his face] All I know is, I'm not afraid of you. I know be, but I'm not. I still want you, whatever you are. And going to leave you. If they come for you, then they'll ha me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: So fight. For both of us. For all of us. I don't wa dust. I want us flesh and blood. Kiss me. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her. First tentatively, then with great passion

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Narcisse knocks, calls through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: What the hell are you doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking, is the answer. They are wound around each other: biting, gasping. Boone thrusts up into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Yes...yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [to himself]: Jesus. Bastard does better dead th alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The connecting door flies open, a rejuvenated Boone and L into the office where Narcisse and Rachel are waiting. Na with the unconscious Cormack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: About time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Midian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: It's about time they saw the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs, Joyce, Tommy and Pettine wait outside the gates. P paces. Joyce looks at his watch, moves over to Pettine an quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: How long until dark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE: Two hours. Two and a half. I told 'em to bring g We'll burn the bastards out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Has it occurred to you maybe we've got this all wr could be destroying...I don't know, a whole new species.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE: You saw that fucker below, Lieutenant, same as m damn thing was just too weird to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Maybe they're just different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE: Isn't that enough reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce stares at him. In background, Tommy starts to holle calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTINE [cont.]: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy is pointing frantically at a dust cloud in the dist

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A violent cut to the roar of engines as we track with the moving posse. Eigerman stands up out of a skylight in the truck, eggs on the other vehicles with a rebel war cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Yee-hah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the caravan appears. Ecstasy. Tommy and Gibbs dance a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIBBS: It's the fuckin' cavalry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse speeds down towards the Necropolis gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Narcisse's beat-up car speeds down the highway towards Mi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: How much further?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: A mile, maybe two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We close in on Rachel, who stares ahead of her, as if in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: We're too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Hang on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steering hard, he veers the car off the road and into thi Branches thrash against the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [cont.]: This is a shortcut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse is busily at work around the Necropolis, Eigerm supervising. Some are laying trails of gasoline through t Others are simply patrolling, guns in hand. There is an a nervous anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashberry comes round a tomb and we follow him down a walk staring in awe at the mausoleums and statuary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking at a particularly large tomb, Ashberry's eye is c by a large, fantastically rendered marble winged angel. H it, reaches up to touch it. The angel, a monster, turns t him with sad, impassive gravity. Then we see its shadow o face and hear the slow, thick beating of its wings as it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashberry's stunned. He fumbles the top of his bourbon can takes a long drink, then stops when he sees a load of dyn to the side of the tomb. He follows the wire that leads o another dynamite pack on an adjacent tomb and then anothe panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kane is escorting Eigerman and Pettine down a pathway, po the posse's handiwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE: ...packets of plastique at every intersection, trip outside the biggest tombs, we figure those'll be the majo routes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: How much longer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE: Five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN [into walkie-talkie]: Let's pull back to the per before we lose the light. We've got movement underground; they're hearing it round the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY [approaching them from the side]: Captain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE: Jesus, not there, STOP. [Ashberry freezes] We got C planted in the rosebushes, Reverend, cut your nuts off  faster'n a hedge clipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY: We've made a mistake, there are Angels here, a host...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: You're drunk, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashberry dumps the bourbon out of his canteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY: No. Listen to me, it's wrong, it's sacrilege, t ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Get the hell up that hill, you pinhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY: You brought me here because I'm a man of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: That's right; hang round here a couple more min Padre, and you'll be sitting at his left hand. Now get yo out of the fuckin' way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eigerman backhands him. Ashberry falls. Eigerman, Kane, P the other cops begin to pull back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashberry looks up, as he hears grindings and growls in th Boone is lifting off the top of a nearby tomb. Ashberry i shoot when Narcisse grabs him around the throat, puts a f lips and signals him to be quiet. Narcisse follows Boone tomb. The tomb-lid scrapes as it's pushed back into place beneath. Ashberry starts to pray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone and Narcisse move through the panicking underground fleeing in every direction. Boone sees Lylesburg, trying panic down, moves towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Stay down! Stay where you are, they're waiting above...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [intercepting him]: No! if you stay here you'll be slaughtered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: This is our home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Not anymore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: We belong here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Listen to me, old man, the rules change; if you wa it won't be here and it won't be by your laws...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other creatures have stopped, watching the confrontation. speaks to them as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [cont.]: If you'want to survive we've got to fight can't hide anymore! [to Lylesburg] What's it gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lylesburg slumps, acquiescing, unable to refuse Boone's a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [cont.] [to Narcisse]: Get the children above groun hiding place...[to the others] Get ready to fight! [to Ly What about Baphomet? Can he be moved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLESBURG: Yes. It could be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: It must be done. Brothers and sisters, it's time t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy and Lude listen to Boone on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEROY: You hear what he said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUDE: What chance have we got? They're armed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEROY [opens jacket]: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two one-eyed snakes, nesting in Leroy's belly, slide up f innards and wrap around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEROY: They call us monsters, remember? They're afraid of give 'em reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUDE: It's a long time since I spilled blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEROY: You never lose the knack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From this high vantage point, Decker watches the preparat through binoculars, with the glee of a pyromaniac at a fi The sun is setting. He stares up at it, squinting into it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MASK [V.O.]: ...I'm waiting...Philip?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker looks towards the patrol car parked nearby. The fr open. On the passenger seat sits his briefcase. Decker qu crosses to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MASK [V.O.]: Let me out, Philip. There's going to be I want to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker opens the briefcase. The mask and his knives are l inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MASK: Ah, that's better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: We can't let anyone see us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MASK: I want to be free!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE [V.O.]: Decker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker swings round, slamming the case shut, as Joyce app

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Lieutenant...[covering flawlessly] You gave me su

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Eigerman's invited you to watch from the command p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Oh, I don't think I'm up to it, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: ...I've got a bad feeling about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Believe me, Lieutenant, whoever or whatever's liv there deserves what's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE: Monsters, you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Unnatural, misbegotten creatures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
