dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eigerman jumps from the vehicle, as the retreating posse Berserkers. It's a useless response. Bloodied but unbowed Berserkers run at the vehicles. The woman throws herself Gibbs isn't quick enough. One of the Berserkers pushes th the wall of the Necropolis, and Blatz, a small, vicious c stamps on the roof. Inside, Gibbs cowers as the roof is b is crushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce, who has been watching this entire scene, moves awa gate towards the Necropolis. The fires are dying down somewhat, and an eerie half-light bathes the scene he mov A few surviving posse hurry away, firing at every movemen shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the gate we see one of the escaping Berserkers fl car over, while his brothers dispatch posse members. The simply drop their weapons and flee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog-faced man lies dead at the door and beside him Ba face subtly bestial. Joyce hears Babette weeping; her cri hard. He goes to her, gathers her up gently in his arms. clings to him; he sees her arms are partially transformed but he keeps holding her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone emerges from the depths, into the wrecked mausoleum

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE: Boone...[he goes to them] Lori. She's hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babette points outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori runs, Decker follows, his steps steady, relentless a Lori takes another stride and the ground gives way beneat slides down into the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone is tracking them, Joyce following, carrying Babette vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE: Falling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos, and collapse. Earth is falling all around. Lori pi up and finds her way back up is blocked by debris. She ha but to cross the swaying walkways, while the air thickens and smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are only one or two Breed left alive down here, des collecting their belongings. They exit the chamber leavin smoking bowls...We track towards the bowls, as the conten and bubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori descends a flight of stairs, to find Peloquin badly the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: It's all over. I didn't believe the prophesies it's all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: What prophesies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peloquin takes her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: You want to see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peloquin pushes Lori ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We track towards the mural. Lori can barely believe her e laid out on the walls, is a whole history; and featured a more recent additions, the face of Boone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: Yes, it's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone squatting in front of his fire of love letters. Boo the reeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: All these years waiting for a saviour. But he h us. He's destroyed us. I made him, and he's destroyed us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Made him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: The bite was mine. The bite that mocks death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: That doesn't make him yours. I belong here on this as much as you do. Why aren't I here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: You're still a Natural. Go back while you've st life. Join your tribe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: That? My tribe? Not any longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELOQUIN: Then die with us. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peloquin exits. Lori looks back at the images on the wall more. Then she exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone, Joyce and Babette approach the hole where Lori fel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE: Let me down. I can't go any further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE [looking down into the hole]: Baphomet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE [to Joyce]: Take her. Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce nods and moves off with her into the smoke. As she Decker steps forward from the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Quite a dance, huh? Death everywhere and you and middle. Catch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the head of a Breed at Boone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Even the dead can die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Decker strikes out at him, slashing at Boone's face. falls backwards. At the last moment he catches hold of De pulling him down into the hole and together they tumble i earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone and Decker land on one of the rope bridges. Boone h it, pursued by Decker, who slashes at his neck, cutting h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DECKER: Almost!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone falls back. Decker closes on him, the knives at his force of his stabs, which miss Boone's neck, break the bo bridge. Boone braces his feet beneath Decker and tosses h Decker gets up and approaches him again, slashing the rop bridge with his blades as he comes. The fighters connect struggle, their violent motion carrying them over the edg bridge, dropping them down another level. Decker lands ve and lies still. Boone gets up. His exit along the bridge direction is blocked. He has to step past Decker who does move. Only when Boone has stepped beyond him does Decker pursuing Boone across the bridge, and flinging one of the knives at his victim's back. The blade cuts straight thro sticking out from his chest a good six inches. He turns, transforming him into a more extreme creature. Decker com with a second blade, slashing at Boone's neck. The battle them off the bridge onto the stairs. Decker takes hold of hair, preparing to deliver the coup de grace. Boone reach weapon, finds a skull, and smashes it into the mask. Deck Boone tumbles off the stairs, falling face down on a card

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker follows down the stairs. Boone pulls the table off leaving the Ace of Hearts on the blade in his chest. Deck through, driving Boone back into one of the Breed's rooms fight continues. Decker takes a whip from the wall and us disarm Boone, who has snatched up a bone to defend himsel Boone snatches up a second bone and retaliates, deliverin blow against Decker, eventually knocking the knife from h driving him out on to the ledge once more. Decker teeters edge, now defenceless. Boone approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Want to dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches the mask off Decker's face and draws him clos Decker on his own blade. Decker screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Boone pushes him off the blade, and over the edge of Decker falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone stands on the ledge, and spits down at the corpse. so he hears the same roar from Baphomet that called the Berserkers from harming him. Out of it, comes Baphomet's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAPHOMET [V.O.]: Boone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chamber is empty of life. There are two or three corp floor. We approach the central dais, on which is perched of Baphomet, surrounded by six white heads. Momentarily, light break from the statue's head and strike the white h in turn begin to glow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the chambers we've seen before we see copies of the si in front of which are bowls of Baphomet's fluid...They be the brightness building. Sparks rise from the fluid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori sits, exhausted, in the corridor. She looks up to se with the knife still transfixing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: My God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Decker's dead. Take the knife out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori pulls the knife from him, and throws it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAPHOMET [V.O.]: Boone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Don't go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I'm. responsible. I have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori and Boone head down the corridor, passing Ashberry, standing in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori and Boone head down the stairs towards the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blinding light. As Boone descends into the chamber, he se Nightbreed, surviving members of a Senior Council, Rachel standing around Baphomet. They are wrapping severed limbs Baphomet, preparing to include him in the exodus. His hea shoulders remain suspended in the light. Baphomet's lips a terrible, eloquent sound. Rachel translates, the deep v coming from her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL/BAPHOMET: Come closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone obeys. Baphomet's remaining arm reaches down and ho as Baphomet's face stares down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL/BAPHOMET: ...You have destroyed our refuge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I never meant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baphomet silences him. Boone trembles but maintains eye c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL/BAPHOMET: This was foretold. No refuge is forever. are charged . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL/BAPHOMET: ...You must rebuild what you've destroye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL/BAPHOMET: That you must find yourself. In the worl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: I don't...I don't know how...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL/BAPHOMET: You shall not be alone. You will find me heal me. [holds him close] You are not Boone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now the words emerge from Baphomet himself, shaking t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAPHOMET: ...you are Cabal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone/Cabal is released. Baphomet is consumed in light. T move towards him to finish their task.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI [O.S.]: Boone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone/Cabal turns; Lori stands at the bottom of the slope a hand. He takes it, they start up the slope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cowering in a niche inside the chamber, out of sight, wat wonder is Ashberry. Transfixed by Baphomet, he crosses hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone/Cabal glances back. The Council receive pieces of B from the light wrapping his smoking fragments in shrouds. The light builds to its brightest level. Pieces begin to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bowls start to explode with sparks of white light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone/Cabal and Lori race up towards the surface, as Midi continues to collapse around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashberry descends the stairs into the blaze of light. Tea down his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches as the Council prepare to take down Baphomet's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near to him is one of the bowls of Baphomet's light. Ashb approaches it, hungry for a taste of this glory. He reach the bowl. As he does so Baphomet's eyes fix on him. The b the air. The fluid it holds rains down on Ashberry like a falls back, his body smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone/Cabal and Lori reach the surface and race through t Necropolis, flames all around them. And then, behind them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tentacles attached to Baphomet's head are detached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blaze of light instantly begins to diminish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights start to go out in the core, and earth begins from the tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see it flood the various corridors, with a shuddering

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We glimpse Baphomet's head being covered by the Council, roars increase...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone/Cabal and Lori find Joyce, holding Babette, protect near the gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce steps back from the form of Rachel, who pulls her v her and holds out her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: Give me my child...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce looks at Lori, Boone/Cabal, at Babette and Rachel. hands the child over. Rachel holds Babette and they both into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYCE [to Boone/Cabal]: ...I never understood...nobody ev

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps away from them and the night engulfs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The earth has almost obliterated the core entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roar ceases. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori and Boone stand in the reeds as the last, bright blo fires dies away on their faces. Figures move away through creatures we recognize. The drummer beats out a tattoo as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Narcisse appears from the darkness. As he does so, a fina roars up from the underground. In the smoke pillar above Baphomet's image momentarily appears before the wind disp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Never piss off a God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori looks up into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's P.O.V. of the sky, with other Breed, spirits of sm light, moving away into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Where are they going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Any hiding place they can find. It'll be dawn s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOONE: When I need you where will I find you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: You'll find me. And you will need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches to shake Boone's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE: Never touched a legend before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs his manic laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NARCISSE [cont.] [to Lori]: Good night, pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fades into the night, the laughter going with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the burning ruins of Midian. The wind si moonlit reeds. Cabal and Lori reach the top of the hill, look down, standing apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CABAL: I'll have to start tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I'll go with you, Boone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CABAL: I'm not Boone, Lori. Do you understand? I belong t now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Then make me belong too; they made you one of them, it to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CABAL: I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I want to be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CABAL: I'll come back for you when I'm finished...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: And when's that gonna be, when I'm ninety and you'r way you are? I went through hell to find you and you just, just walk away from me? [pause; broken-hearted] Wel then, just go. Go on! What more do you want? Leave me som for Christ's sake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. She turns away, trying not to show him her pain. C to go. Lori turns back, sees him going. She can't bear it around, sees Decker's briefcase lying beside the police c it, finds a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Boone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns. She puts the blade to her belly and drives it i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CABAL: Lori, NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cries out and sinks to the ground in terrible pain. H her and holds her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: I lied, I lied, you're all I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CABAL: Don't die, God, Lori, don't die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: Well why don't you do something about it, God damn remember what you said...[fading]...quickly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises her neck to his mouth. Her eyes flicker closed. A fatal, bloody kiss. He rises from her. Her eyes are clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CABAL: ...too late?...Oh God, too late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes open. She's turned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI: You said you'd never leave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grins, presses up to kiss his bloodied mouth. Camera off them to find the moon and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We track through the ruins of the Necropolis. The walls a blackened by fires that are almost extinguished; corpses Breed] lie in barely distinguishable bundles, from which cremated limbs jut. Smoke hangs in the air. From the dist Eigerman, going amongst the corpses, reclaiming guns, bul grenades. As we get closer we realize that he is a broken face dirty, his eyes lunatic. He's been crying, the track the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, he hears a noise, and stands up to see a large appearing from the smoke. He goes for his own gun, levell the figure as it approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: Keep your distance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure keeps coming, emerging from the smoke. It's As has been transformed by the confrontation with Baphomet. been almost burned away entirely and there is a subtle reconfiguration in the shape of his skull. His clothes ar tatters. There are hints that his once broken body, poiso alcohol, has taken on new strength. He looks as insane as but stronger in his lunacy. There's a dangerous fervour i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY: I saw their God...I saw him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY: I can still smell him. He's out there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashberry walks past Eigerman towards the exit from Necrop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: You mean you can find them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY: Oh yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: We'll go together then. You can lead me to the Then I'll wipe them all away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHBERRY: No. They're mine. Their God burned me. I want t back. All of them. Burn them all away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGERMAN: You can't, you don't have the wits ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashberry turns on him, his face wild. He takes hold of Ei the neck, his fingers digging into the muscle. Blood runs tries to raise the gun but Ashberry takes hold of the man summarily snaps his wrist. The gun is dropped. Ashberry s lift Eigerman up off the ground. The policeman's flailing suddenly. The head lolls. Ashberry flings the body aside, out of the Necropolis. As he approaches the exit he looks Sunlight falls on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shining, full. We move down to find a derelict barn, stan in a vast field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We track through the darkness to find Rachel, Babette, Ki number of other refugees and children of Midian, staring night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE: ...who will come for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KINSKI: His name is Cabal. He unmade Midian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE: How soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL: On the next wind. If not tonight, then tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babette gazes out over the cornfields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE: On the next wind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cabal and Lori, standing on the hill, against a backgroun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABETTE [V.O.]: ...if not tonight...tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving through the ruined chambers, illuminated by dying flame, we find and track along the end of the heroic mosa tells, in a rush of images, the story of the ruin of Midi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera comes to a stop on the final image: Cabal and Lori just saw them, on a hill, framed against the star-filled

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the wind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fade to black.
